definition: to waken (to action)/to rouse (the masses)/to evoke (attention, recollection etc)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Fire insurance may be sold by appealing to fear of loss.
sentences.chinese: 火險可能是通過喚起對損失的恐懼而售出的。

sentences.english: The scene awakens reminiscences of my youth.
sentences.chinese: 這景象喚起我年輕時的往事。

sentences.english: The horse brings out human feelings the way machines cannot do.
sentences.chinese: 馬能喚起人類的情感，機械則不能。

sentences.english: He whispered something in the old man's ears to jog his memory.
sentences.chinese: 他向那位老人耳語了幾句，以喚起他的回憶。

sentences.english: And Shen who get along, aroused the feelings of the Chinese man Shen shen.
sentences.chinese: 和沈凡的相處，喚起了曼華對沈凡的情感。

sentences.english: He roused the masses with his oratory .
sentences.chinese: 他以其雄辯術喚起民衆。

sentences.english: One is reminded of the idealized image of feudal Europe presented by latter-day conservative Catholics such as G.
sentences.chinese: 這喚起了我們對中世紀歐洲的理想化印象，它在G。

sentences.english: Liu Cixin's writing evokes the thrill of exploration and the beauty of scale.
sentences.chinese: 劉慈欣的作品喚起了人們對探索和宏觀之美的興奮感。

sentences.english: The studies of Foucault and New Historicism have aroused people's awareness of the discourse of power.
sentences.chinese: 福柯和新歷史主義批評喚起了人們對權力話語的覺醒。

sentences.english: The conscious mind is complicit in it, but a lot of sexual arousal goes on in the sympathetic nervous system.
sentences.chinese: 顯意識與此相關，但許多性喚起受交感神經系統控制。

sentences.english: Handsome architecture evokes Irish tradition and contemporary chic.
sentences.chinese: 恆順建築喚起愛爾蘭傳統與當代時尚。

sentences.english: All civilization ought to be aroused against war.
sentences.chinese: 應喚起整個文明世界來反對戰爭。

sentences.english: Does the smell of fresh-baked cookies bring you back to your childhood?
sentences.chinese: 剛出爐的麪包是否常喚起你童年的回憶？

sentences.english: Think about related words and phrases that evoke the feelings you want.
sentences.chinese: 想一想能夠喚起你想要的感覺的相關詞彙。

sentences.english: The old movie evoked the memory of his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 這部舊電影喚起他童年時的回憶。

definition: to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
to promote/to enhance/to further/to advance (a cause etc)
care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
